page.title: 03HISTORY OF M'BRO PART 2
page.content: A railway was needed to transport the iron from the hills to the river.Houses were needed for the dockers and miners to live in, and shops to provide them with clothes and food. Steel works were built near to Middlesbrough so that the iron ore could be turned to steel before it was shipped to other parts of the country. This meant more, people, more houses and more shops. The centre of Middlesbrough used to be on the Northern side of the railway line near to the river, and the first town hall can still be seen today.The centre of town moved almost one mile to the South when a much bigger town hall was built half a century later. The town is now a major centre for refining North sea oil, as well as having Europes biggest chemical plant.
